CBC.description: Measures different components of blood including red blood cells, white blood cells, and platelets
CBC.indications: Recommended for fever, fatigue, weakness, infection, inflammation, or anemia symptoms
CBC.interpretation_guide: Low hemoglobin suggests anemia. High WBC indicates infection or inflammation. Low platelets may indicate bleeding disorder.

CRP.description: Measures inflammation levels in the body
CRP.indications: Recommended for fever, joint pain, suspected infection, or inflammatory conditions
CRP.interpretation_guide: Elevated CRP indicates inflammation or infection in the body. Values above 10 mg/L suggest acute infection.

Blood_Glucose.description: Measures blood sugar levels after fasting
Blood_Glucose.indications: Recommended for diabetes screening, frequent urination, excessive thirst, fatigue, or family history of diabetes
Blood_Glucose.interpretation_guide: Values 100-125 mg/dL indicate prediabetes. Values above 126 mg/dL suggest diabetes. Low values below 70 mg/dL indicate hypoglycemia.

Lipid_Profile.indications: Recommended for cardiovascular risk assessment, obesity, family history of heart disease, or high blood pressure
Lipid_Profile.interpretation_guide: High LDL increases heart disease risk. Low HDL is a risk factor. High triglycerides indicate metabolic issues.

Thyroid_Panel.indications: Recommended for fatigue, weight changes, hair loss, mood changes, or suspected thyroid disorders
Thyroid_Panel.interpretation_guide: High TSH with low T4 indicates hypothyroidism. Low TSH with high T4 suggests hyperthyroidism.

Liver_Function.indications: Recommended for jaundice, abdominal pain, dark urine, alcohol use, or liver disease symptoms
Liver_Function.interpretation_guide: Elevated ALT and AST indicate liver damage. High bilirubin causes jaundice and suggests liver or bile duct problems.

Kidney_Function.description: Evaluates kidney health and filtration capacity
Kidney_Function.indications: Recommended for high blood pressure, diabetes, urinary problems, or kidney disease symptoms
Kidney_Function.interpretation_guide: Elevated creatinine and BUN indicate reduced kidney function or kidney disease.

Vitamin_D.description: Measures vitamin D levels in blood
Vitamin_D.indications: Recommended for bone pain, muscle weakness, fatigue, or limited sun exposure
Vitamin_D.interpretation_guide: Levels below 20 ng/mL indicate deficiency. Levels 20-30 ng/mL indicate insufficiency.

fever.reasoning: Fever indicates possible infection or inflammation requiring blood count and inflammatory marker assessment

fatigue.reasoning: Fatigue can result from anemia, thyroid dysfunction, or vitamin deficiency

weight_loss.reasoning: Unexplained weight loss may indicate thyroid disorder or diabetes

joint_pain.reasoning: Joint pain suggests inflammatory condition requiring CRP and blood work

chest_pain.reasoning: Chest pain requires cardiovascular risk assessment via lipid profile

jaundice.reasoning: Jaundice indicates liver dysfunction requiring comprehensive liver function assessment

frequent_urination.reasoning: Frequent urination may indicate diabetes or kidney problems

weakness.reasoning: Weakness can result from anemia, thyroid issues, or blood sugar problems

abdominal_pain.reasoning: Abdominal pain may indicate liver, pancreas, or digestive issues

headache.reasoning: Chronic headaches may be related to anemia or other blood disorders

above_40.reasoning: Routine cardiovascular and diabetes screening recommended for adults over 40

above_50.reasoning: Comprehensive metabolic screening recommended for adults over 50
